meanings.definition: Most likely to break or shatter easily.
meanings.sent1: The cookie was the brittlest of all, crumbling at the lightest touch.
meanings.sent2: The old vase was the brittlest in the collection, ready to shatter at any moment.
meanings.sent3: The brittlest leaves on the tree danced in the wind, threatening to fall and break.
meanings.sent4: His voice was the brittlest of all, cracking under the weight of his emotions.
meanings.sent5: The ice sculpture was the brittlest masterpiece, delicate and easily shattered.

meanings.definition: Most likely to snap or crack under pressure.
meanings.sent1: The twig was the brittlest, snapping with a loud crack as he stepped on it.
meanings.sent2: The brittlest branches on the tree broke under the weight of the snow, making a sharp sound.
meanings.sent3: The brittlest pencil in the box snapped in half, surprising the student.
meanings.sent4: His patience was the brittlest, cracking under the stress of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The brittlest glass in the window shattered with a single tap, showing its fragility.
